programme.title: Superheroes Decoded
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at how comic-book characters took over mainstream culture, dominating the box office and becoming part of the global zeitgeist.

programme.title: Superheroes Decoded
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at superheroes that challenged authority in battles reflecting real-world divisions and struggles.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Johnnie finds some of Dwight Eisenhower's writing, and Yankee tries to restore an old go-kart.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Country singer Tracy Lawrence brings a guitar from the 1920s to the shop, and Jimmie checks out a mechanical bull and a pot for cooking crayfish.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator teams up with Daniel Browning Smith to find people with abilities that would not seem out of place in one of his comics.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The death of 11-year-old Christopher Alan Brown, whose body was recovered from the Flint River, Michigan, in April 1985. It took 23 years to find and convict his killers.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: Ben and Frankie take on a Porsche 911, while George and Sheldon opt for a Maserati 3200 GT.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders head for the East Texas town of Tyler, where Jenny finds a valuable piece of musical memorabilia - but one of her competitors ends up out of pocket.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba try to keep their lucky streak going as the bidders return to old haunts, while Jenny discovers her inner ballerina.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba faces a tough decision, and Matt Blevins enters into a battle of the sexes with female bidders in the small town of Pantego.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny Stowe shows off his wealth during an auction in Dallas, and Bubba responds by challenging him to a bidding war.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Excuse Me, I Think You're Stupid
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce at an auction in Fort Worth, where Cowboy Matt and Kenny fight over an abandoned item of furniture.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny acquires a locker full of martial arts equipment that puts him in a compromising position. Mary reveals the extent of her ambition and Jenny uses underhand tactics.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank pick through the junk at an airport and are tempted by vintage pedal cars. However, they find the owner will not part with them easily.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz locate a 1947 Harley-Davidson Knucklehead, and are given VIP access to the untouched stash of a former antiques shop owner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Franz pay another visit to Hobo Jack to see if there are any new finds in his junkyard.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les argue over an important decision, while a scientist turns up in the shop claiming his vintage device can cure diseases.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A couple try to exchange a pair of earrings for a promise ring, but Les declares the stones purchased for $1,000 as fake.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth intervenes in a confrontation between a customer and an employee in the car park, and is later given a 30th birthday surprise by his colleagues.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A family feud leads to Ashley's resignation. Meanwhile, a couple of women try to sell a dirty fur coat and a man offers to pawn his gold tooth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey and Rene buy a small, mysterious unit, and discover it contains a Wizard of Oz chess set.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod attends auctions in Mission Viejo and ends up with some unusual art on his hands. Barry's accountant tries to stop him from spending too much money.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Ivy battle it out at a locker auction in Lancaster, California, while Jarrod and Brandi buy some DJ equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: An LA auction brings more competition than the buyers were expecting, and Dave Hester returns despite his chequered history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy finds a way to lighten the mood in the hot California sun, but the bidding wars that ensue are anything but cool.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the prices of an antique pistol, a mining certificate issued to Mark Twain and a valuable Spider-Man comic.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys buy a valuable 1961 guitar, and discover a copy of National Geographic covering the first moon landing.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a ring that once belonged to notorious 1930s gangster Lucky Luciano and a letter signed by a famous American football coach.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine memoirs of the Duke and Duchess of Windsor signed by the couple themselves, and a collection of tin army trucks from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine rare hand-made Pinocchio dolls, a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith lead singer Steven Tyler, and a valuable baseball card from 1909.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are tempted by a musket owned by famous inventor Eli Whitney and a golf ball that once belonged to president Lyndon B Johnson.

programme.title: Bigfoot Captured
programme.desc: A hunt for the legendary man-ape creature, whose very existence is yet to be proved. A team of experts contemplates whether he could be roaming forests and hiding in the shadows undetected. The documentary includes footage of a sasquatch apparently caught on camera.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: It's Bring Your Kids to Work Day
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi take their children to an auction during spring break, while Darrell puts his 'Gambler' nickname to the test.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have some fun as they attempt to beat the competition, while Casey tries her hand at bidding.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey checks out a Colt Army Model 1860 revolver from the Civil War, while Rick sets his sights on a Viking coin and Chum hatches a plan to get a pay rise.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
programme.desc: A series of interlinked stories about the Los Angeles underworld. A hitman plays minder to his boss's wife, and he and his partner deal with a dead body following a mishap with a gun. Meanwhile, a washed-up boxer goes on the run after refusing to throw a fight, and two lovers plot a hold-up in a diner. Quentin Tarantino's crime drama, starring John Travolta, Samuel L Jackson, Uma Thurman, Bruce Willis, Ving Rhames, Tim Roth and Amanda Plummer.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: A two-part special welcoming back the champions from the first five series - Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Jack Dee, Matthew Crosby, Shappi Khorsandi and Julian Clary join stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies to discuss a range of offbeat issues.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Alan, Jason Manford, Jo Joyner, Joe Lycett and the Reverend Richard Coles talk Christmas. Contains Strong Language and Mature Themes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Kevin and Andrew Buckles engage in zany DIY projects, including building a souped-up swim raft for chilling out on their lake.

programme.title: Brojects
programme.desc: Kevin and Andrew build a pizza oven for the outdoors and a human-powered blender bike.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Highlights from the series, featuring some of Mike and Frank's greatest finds.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori find a piece of rock 'n' roll history.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier bids against his arch-rival Jesse on a movie monster.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz make good on a promise to restore a 1935 Auburn and take the original owners for a ride.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Vigilantes confront a man whom they believe is a paedophile, and the team search for a suspect armed with a meat cleaver.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: The team transform a 1958 Chevy Apache into a Vintage Dirt Bike Hauler. Elsewhere, Steve Darnell attempts to bring Evel Knievel's Formula 1 Dragster back to life.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, revealing what makes its officers tick, how they deal with the tragedies they inevitably have to face and how much they rely on each other and also their camaraderie.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: With the delivery date for the ultimate Vintage Dirt Bike Hauler imminent, Steve pushes his crew and Welder Up's reputation for building the meanest and fastest rods is challenged.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three lightweight supercars across Europe in search of the continent's best roads, and Jeremy looks at Volkswagen's decision to put a Bentley engine in the Golf. Helen Mirren is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May revisit their bid to build amphibious vehicles, and face one of their toughest challenges yet. The Audi R8 takes to the track and Jools Holland tests his driving ability as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Guests Jessica Hynes, Phill Jupitus and Jo Brand join regular contributor Alan Davies and host Stephen Fry in the quiz show. Subjects under discussion include domesticity - and as usual the questions are so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams of celebs try to call each other's bluff with a few stories about themselves that might be true or might be out-and-out porkies. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are comedians Jo Brand, Roisin Conaty and Paul Foot, and TV wildlife presenter Ray Mears.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. Screen hardman Ray Winstone, comic Josh Widdicombe, maths whizz Rachel Riley and actor Ricky Tomlinson join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with a few festive fibs or facts about themselves. Does one of the contestants really apologise to their boiled egg before smashing its head in? Who apparently writes Christmas cards with their feet? And did one of the line-up really prevent their bandmate joining the Beatles?.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: All Girls Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: A female-only special of the comedy show, showcasing some of the funniest women to have graced the stage at London's Hammersmith Apollo. The programme features routines by Sara Pascoe, Sarah Millican, Lucy Porter, Roisin Conaty, Katherine Ryan, Ellie Taylor, Michelle Wolf, Jen Brister, Shappi Khorsandi, Francesca Martinez, Andi Osho and Celia Pacquola.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: A two-part special welcoming back the champions from the first five series - Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, beginning the 'L' series with a range of fiendish questions on the animal kingdom, taking in everything from lonely whales to larval locomotives. Showing off their knowledge of all things natural are comedians Sarah Millican, Ross Noble and Colin Lane, who join regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy panel quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of location, with points being awarded as usual for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Irish actress, comedienne and writer Aisling Bea makes her debut appearance on the programme, joining fellow stand-ups Jason Manford and Johnny Vegas and regular panellist Alan Davies, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: This edition of the documentary series takes a look at the town of Sodom, which is thought to have existed in ancient Palestine.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the validity of the Bible's best-known stories. Two different theories about Moses' dramatic parting of the Red Sea are examined. The original Hebrew version of the Bible contains references to a 'reed sea' where it is thought the crossing may have occurred.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at the sinister history of Edinburgh's vaults and the development of Helsinki's subterranean spaces. Plus, the impact of the building of Naples on the volcanic ground below.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Ruins from the time before the fall of the Berlin Wall, including a covert Communist base that hid Cold War submarines for Tito and the former HQ of the Soviet Army in East Germany.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: White Pass and Yukon Railroad - The Gold Rush Railway
programme.desc: The White Pass and Yukon Railroad over the US-Canada border, which began construction after the Klondike Gold Rush in the late 19th century and saw 35 workers lose their lives.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim and the team investigate when a dismembered body is found under the floorboards of a Glasgow house. Things take a turn for the worse when the victim's nine-month-old baby is kidnapped from a multi-storey car park. Drama, starring Mark McManus, Neil Duncan, Harriet Buchan and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice contemplates expanding the business, while an unexpected offer from one of Jack's old flames has bittersweet consequences. Starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Tired of being undermined by Florence, Tilly resigns as head seamstress. Meanwhile, Evie spends a weekend working for the wealthy Duglass family - but finds herself caught in the middle of a feud. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads receive an emergency call while on jungle manoeuvres Down Under, and rush off to Hope Bay, the village adjacent to their camp, which has just been devastated by a cyclone. Taylor manfully puts affairs of the heart on hold to supervise rescue operations, but unfortunately, not everyone can be saved.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Neil speedily steps into a convalescing Jack Meadows' shoes, much to the dismay of Debbie McAllister, who takes a dim view of his unseemly haste to take over. Rob organises a disastrous raid on the Radfords' club, while Samantha receives a video of missing daughter Abi, belatedly bringing Phil Hunter round to the view that the youngster has been kidnapped.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On the day of the christening, Chrissie has a shocking announcement for Owen. Will faces a tough decision as his work and family priorities clash and Jess feels overjoyed about her relationship with Zubin.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Toxic fumes are released into the atmosphere when chemical additives accidentally spill while being delivered to a swimming pool, while a violent drug addict causes havoc inside an ambulance. Gloria's former lover and current landlord evicts her, and Richard experiences problems with blurred vision.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina orders Kerry to sever her ties with the Radford family or leave the Met. The Sun Hill sniper claims another victim, raising fears that he's being fed information by a police insider - or may actually work at the station. Behind the scenes, Gabriel gleefully seizes an opportunity to cause renewed friction between Jim and June.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant reckons he has a solution to his and Sharon's problems. Mark is delighted when Gill pays him a visit, but what will Rachel's reaction be to his old girlfriend turning up?.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A dramatic confrontation erupts which will change the lives of those involved.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: Four-part adaptation of Charlotte Bronte's novel about an orphan girl who struggles to survive the harsh treatment of a boarding school to embark on a career as a governess. Jane takes up her first position at the home of the alluring and unpredictable Edward Rochester, under the watchful eye of laundrywoman Grace Poole. Ruth Wilson, Toby Stephens and Francesca Annis star.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: Jane begins to wonder about the chemistry between herself and Rochester, who disappoints her when he leaves without warning. However, he returns with a houseful of distinguished guests, including the beautiful Blanche Ingram and her opinionated mother. Things turn sour when a mysterious visitor arrives. Ruth Wilson, Toby Stephens and Francesca Annis star.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: After fulfilling her dying aunt's last wishes, Jane returns to Thornfield Hall - only to find Mr Rochester is set to wed Blanche. However, after she confesses her love, he shares his true feelings and asks for her hand in marriage instead. While all seems well at first, a ghostly figure begins to torment Jane as the wedding day draws near. Drama, with Ruth Wilson and Toby Stephens.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: A clergyman and his two sisters take a heartbroken Jane under their wing after finding her alone and starving on the moors. The governess embarks on a new life as a parish teacher, but thinks she hears Rochester call out her name and feels compelled to return to Thornfield - where the secrets of the North Tower are finally revealed. Starring Ruth Wilson and Toby Stephens.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Domestic disharmony ensues for the Meldrews as a routine trip to the garden centre starts a trail of turmoil including a scowling snowman, a laughing policeman and a mysterious saboteur. Christmas edition of David Renwick's comedy from 1994, starring Richard Wilson, Annette Crosbie and Angus Deayton.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When a man is found dead inside a locked bank vault, Father Brown must solve the mystery to save an innocent man from paying the ultimate price. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

credits.actor: Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man is found murdered on his boat five miles out at sea, with no possible way a killer could have escaped. At first Humphrey turns his attention to the small group he was with the night before he died - but as the investigation deepens, the investigation takes an unexpected turn that requires the team to leave the comfort of their Caribbean island - and go searching for their suspects in London. Kris Marshall stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman with dementia runs away from her care home and turns up at a south London police station to report a murder - sparking a reinvestigation into the mysterious disappearance of her police officer husband in 1956. The official report says that he fell into the river after one too many beers - but what secrets was this seemingly straight-as-a die old-fashioned bobby keeping? Meanwhile, Steve's son is arrested for buying weed, bringing the retired cop face to face with his ex-wife - a woman he hasn't seen in 10 years. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance from Julie Graham.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Glamorous opera singer Eleanor Samson becomes the prime suspect in a murder case after her estranged husband's lover is found in the burnt-out shell of a boat. Taggart's assistant Peter Livingstone believes Eleanor is guilty, but the grizzled detective's instincts suggest otherwise. Crime drama, guest starring Isla Blair with Mark McManus and Neil Duncan.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Hangover (2009)
programme.desc: Three men on a stag weekend in Las Vegas wake up after a night of heavy drinking and find they have not only misplaced the groom, but somehow gained a tiger and a baby. Unable to remember the details of the night before, they set about piecing the clues together in the hope of finding their missing friend. Comedy, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis.

programme.title: Flying Scotsman with Robson Green
programme.desc: The presenter spends a year working with the team of engineers who have been commissioned to rebuild the most famous steam engine in the world. Starting in February, Robson is given the task of cutting off the front end of the Scotsman and welding on a whole piece, and sets out to Durham, where he discovers how the invention of the steam engine helped to change the world. After a year in the workshop, the iconic train is ready for its first test run, and Robson realises a lifelong dream and gets to ride on the footplate as it sets off.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Anton Du Beke, Gemma Collins and Paul Sinha to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a family of five answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants David, Joe, Sara and Alexis pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but anyone caught by the Chaser is out for good, leaving fewer players to team up and play in the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Diane worries about what lies in store, Leyla's attraction to Liam grows, and Kim is glad of a distraction.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: It's estimated that three quarters of the things now bought in the United Kingdom are now paid for by card - with some businesses refusing to take cash altogether. As more banks and ATMs disappear from the streets, reporter Adnan Sarwar asks if the nation is on its way to becoming a cashless society.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jai catches Al in the act, Leyla is unsure where she stands, and Moira is thrown into panic.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire Dales, The Malham Cove Walk
programme.desc: The presenter takes a circular walk around Malham in the Yorkshire Dales, taking in the magical Janet's Foss waterfall and the awe-inspiring Gordale Scar. The stunning limestone pavement at Malham Cove - with its spectacular views - is a recognised highlight for those taking on the much longer Pennine Way trail.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: As the murder evidence begins to build, Harper and the team are met with conflicting accounts. Meanwhile, Elizabeth finds herself taunted by one of the suspects and the trouble around the Kamara deal, forcing her to choose between her personal and professional loyalties. As the chief superintendent is deserted by her allies, she enters a dangerous game of cat and mouse. Crime thriller, starring Sarah Parish, David Avery and Charlotte Hope.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino's train journey takes him on a star-studded line-up of Tuscan cities. He begins in Pisa, famous for its leaning tower, and also home of the Vespa scooter, which gives the chef the ideal way to explore the city, before he hops back on the train toward the medieval city of Lucca, the birthplace of composer Puccini. Here, he meets master violin-maker Fabio and rustles up a vegetarian asparagus dish. His final stop is Florence, where he meets Cecilia, one of a network of local cooks keeping traditional recipes alive by opening up her kitchen to guests from all over the world.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh's Late Night Guest List
programme.desc: The host is joined by some of his celebrity friends who, as well as taking part in games, will help one contestant win their place on the best guest-lists in the world. In the first edition, Bradley is joined by This Morning presenter Holly Willoughby, Baby Spice Emma Bunton and her fiance Jade Jones, and actor Nigel Havers.

programme.title: The 5 Stages of A Break Up
programme.desc: Join Sarah Powell as she wipes away your tears and brings you out the other side smiling, as music from Bruno Mars, JoJo and Pink get you through The 5 Stages Of A Break Up.

programme.title: The Cannibal in the Jungle
programme.desc: The story of an American scientist who was convicted of killing and cannibalising two colleagues in the jungles of Flores, Indonesia, in 1977.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The host, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Ed Byrne and Marcus Brigstoke, oversees the contest between The Bob Stewart's from Belfast and The Badger Inn from Cheshire.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt ends in a catastrophic fall, a racing boat breaks up, plunging its crew into heavy seas, and a vintage dragster smashes into a wall.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A military jet crashes after breaking up, a man survives being run over by a tractor trailer, and the safety capsule of a dragboat flies open during a crash.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby Goodson travels to Canada to buy a logging vehicle, leaving Dave Mueller in charge. Meanwhile, there are complications when the team moves to Floyd.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team go in search of a car in need of serious attention, and set to work on its restoration.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lincolnshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits a 16th-century Elizabethan mansion and hits the jackpot at a brewery.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to America in search of a Dodge Charger for expert mechanic Edd China to restore, but the hefty price tag attached to such a famous car could be a problem if the pair are to succeed in selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a Ford Mustang Fastback and gives it to mechanic Edd China to restore, as the duo hope to turn the wreck into a machine worth more than 20,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to get his hands on one of his dad's favourites - a Ford Popular, a car known for being variable in its quality.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The duo relocate across the Atlantic, and Mike Brewer heads to Chicago in search of a rust-free Pontiac GTO - a rare car that he knows will be perfect for kicking off Edd China's US-based workshop.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy deVille picks up an original - and rusty - Mini Clubman, so the team sets to rebuild it with a race-tuned engine. Ant heads to Sweden to sell his refurbed Harley.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Helen brings in a classic '80s BMW E30 and plans one of the garage's most incredible builds yet, augmenting it with a wide-arch body-kit for a menacing post-apocalyptic vibe.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy brings a turbo-charged Porsche 944 into the workshop. They begin by shredding the excess weight so it can be racetrack ready. Plus, a lucrative commission comes in.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy brings in a classic '65 racing Ford Mustang. Ant blew its engine and the owner wasn't happy - now, they have to work together to turn it into a track-busting beauty.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Helen brings a beat-up Volvo 245 estate into the workshop. She convinces Jimmy and Ant that the car has plenty of potential, though they need to get to Sweden for an engine.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy decides it's time for the team to crack America. However, in true Goblin fashion, they only have 10 days to strip, supercharge and upgrade the classic VW Campervan.

programme.title: Extreme Rides
programme.desc: Engineering, passion and dreams collide to give birth to the world's most exciting vehicles - whether it's the world's fastest production car or a jet powered super truck.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a salvage yard in Cheshire containing vintage gym equipment with real muscle. At an antique shop on the south coast, he spots some decorative religious moulds.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The Goblin Works Garage gang opens a bigger workshop to cope with demand, going bolder than ever before with design and restoration work.

programme.title: Big, Big Bikes
programme.desc: Part one of two. A celebration of the excesses of the vehicle, including its most outrageous machines and riders.

programme.title: Two Weeks in Hell
programme.desc: Following the selection process of US Special Forces troops, who face a fortnight of gruelling tasks to test whether they are ready to serve in the famous Green Berets.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: Boy with a Tail: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Featuring a boy from India who has a tail, an eight-foot tall teenager, a man with supersized muscles and a 'lobster woman'.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The hunt for 18-year-old Kelsey Smith, who disappeared from a Kansas Mall in June 2007. The only clue detectives had was the haunting final images of her on surveillance video. The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Pensacola Police investigate the disappearance of popular news reporter Sean Dugas, and find themselves drawn into an addictive world of gaming. Meanwhile, across state a mother vanishes after a family party and a neighbour's CCTV reveals a shocking tale of murder and betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators had to apply their extensive expertise to apprehend murderers who had killed for money.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How the use of behavioural profiling techniques and forensic evidence helped the FBI to identify and apprehend a serial killer who had abducted and murdered two girls.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: Agents Henry Ruiz and Kristi Adams investigate a call about an injured puppy with a deep wound on its neck.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A woman takes her puppy for a check-up and discovers it needs major heart surgery. Following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to save two baby Tasmanian devils that are close to death following a mysterious illness, and a miniature schnauzer when it is attacked by a puffer fish.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Comedian Walks into a Bridal Salon
programme.desc: Comedian Kathy Griffin enlists Randy's help in making use of the salon's mannequins to give her former assistant the surprise of her life.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, locates an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a salvage yard.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a country house sale in Norfolk, and in Glasgow finds a unique tartan piece at a classic tailor's. Plus, he finds his oddest buy ever in Liverpool.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Lambretta Scooter Museum in Weston-super-Mare, and in Walsall, West Midlands, there is a historic haul in one of the UK's last leather factories.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes on a trip to Jersey where he meets the island's biggest hoarder, and at an old manor house, he discovers an estate-made 1950s swing and trapeze.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard buy quirky items in Dorset. Twin sisters show their late father's legacy - vintage cars and steam train memorabilia. Plus, a visit to Luton's oldest hat makers.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard explores an Aladdin's cave of magic carpets in Cumbria and royal biographer Colin Campbell reveals antiques with tragic history from her romantic castle.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A look at life in New York's Bronx Zoo, documenting the routine operations that provide quality care for animals while educating the public on wildlife and conservation.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Two sisters confront their Puerto Rican birth father after a lifetime of abandonment. Plus, an adoptee overlooks her past and bonds with her biological mum..

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Newly reunited sisters uncover another secret held by their mother, and two families explore the complicated relationship of sharing a son. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: My 600lb Life

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A woman undergoes a face transplant, plus a Chinese boy with a very long neck, a girl who has a huge amount of excess hair, and a boy with a large scrotum.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
